page.title: 02Local Government
page.content:
Suffolk County Council is divided into 7 district councils, Sudbury is governed by Babergh District Council. The County Council has 80 elected members and is re-elected every four years. It spent 259 million pounds last year on services like education and health which works out at 423 pounds per person living in Suffolk. The town council looks after its own offices, also the town hall, the market, car parks, public parks and open spaces and the streets and pavements. The population of Suffolk in 1984 was 612,500 and increased 28 times faster between 1973-83 than the population of England as a whole. The largest increase in population in this area has been among people of retirement age.
BY CHRISTOPHER HOWARD.
